tests.name: should emit final result immediately at window end if grace is specified as zero
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 0 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should not emit final result before window end if grace is specified as zero
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 0 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should not emit before window end if no grace period given
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should emit if no grace period and last event more than 24h after previous
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should include out of order events before window end plus grace period passes
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should drop out of order event after window end plus grace period passes
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should handle null values
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(COL1) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should drop events with no key
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should support final results for tumbling windows
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should support final results for tumbling windows with large jump
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 2 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should support final results for session windows
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW SESSION (5 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 0 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should support final results for hopping windows
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW HOPPING (SIZE 5 MILLISECONDS,ADVANCE BY 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should suppress multiple keys
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

tests.name: should suppress after join
statements: CREATE STREAM L (A INT KEY, B INT, C INT) WITH (kafka_topic='LEFT', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM R (A INT KEY, B INT, C INT) WITH (kafka_topic='RIGHT', value_format='JSON');
CREATE STREAM JOINED_OUTPUT AS SELECT * FROM L INNER JOIN R WITHIN 1 SECONDS ON L.A = R.A;
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT L_A, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM JOINED_OUTPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY L_A EMIT FINAL;

sources.name: JOINED_OUTPUT
sources.schema: L_A INT KEY, L_B INT, L_C INT, R_A INT, R_B INT, R_C INT

tests.name: should throw on non windowed tables
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

expectedException.message: EMIT FINAL is only supported for windowed aggregations.

tests.name: should throw if no group by for aggregation
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COUNT(*) as COUNT FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) EMIT FINAL;

expectedException.message: Use of aggregate function COUNT requires a GROUP BY clause.

tests.name: should throw if aggregation is present for group by
statements: CREATE STREAM INPUT (ID STRING KEY, COL1 STRING) WITH (kafka_topic='input_topic',value_format='JSON');
CREATE TABLE OUTPUT AS SELECT ID, COL1 FROM INPUT WINDOW TUMBLING (SIZE 2 MILLISECONDS, GRACE PERIOD 1 MILLISECONDS) GROUP BY ID EMIT FINAL;

expectedException.message: GROUP BY requires aggregate functions in either the SELECT or HAVING clause.
